description: There are vaccines to prevent more than 20 life-threatening diseases, helping people to live
longer, healthier lives. Despite controversy, vaccines remain a necessary tool to continue to
protect and improve the health of populations. This course explores the basics of vaccinology, how
vaccines are licensed and recommended, the vaccine safety system in the U.S., how vaccines are
used to prevent and control disease, the factors influencing vaccine hesitancy, and strategies to
strengthen vaccine confidence. Offered periodically in January term.
